intro: Lisianthius densiflorus, commonly known as the denseflower lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, tubular blooms that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained, volcanic soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
